page.title: 06Making a living
page.content: There is no manufacturing industry in this wholly agricultural area and therefore no employment for workers living outside the area,apart from a few forestry workers and those emp_ loyed occassionally by the Dartmoor National Park Authority. With mechanisation it is possible to work the farms with the minimum of labour,usually within the family.Simil arly guest houses and other establish ments catering for the tourist industry are family concerns. Doccombe is the only hamlet in the area and a few residents commute to work in Exeter or Moretonhampstead but there is a high proportion of retired people.
